results.firPara: What a thoroughly depressing week for English football. By the end of it there was almost a feeling of relief at the Daily Telegraphs investigation turning up a few more names, because it allayed the suspicion that the object of the whole exercise from the start had simply been to bring down the England manager.
results.secPara: While that false impression prevailed there had been a certain amount of sympathy for Sam Allardyce, on the grounds that entrapment should be used only as a last resort to bring criminality to light, and it is a bit harsh to lose your job for being gobby in private when that is what you are famous for in public.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce was the manager England deserved, week of farce suggests | Paul Wilson

results.firPara: West Ham are facing more questions over crowd control measures at the London Stadium after fans clashed following their 1-1 Premier League draw against Middlesbrough.
results.secPara: Fans were seen confronting each other inside the ground then fighting outside it in the Olympic Park, with stewards and police intervening to separate rival groups.
results.webTitle: Police arrest three fans after more trouble at West Ham’s London Stadium

results.firPara: Martin Glenn says the Football Association will happily cooperate with any parliamentary inquiry into the wide-ranging allegations that have emerged over the past week and cost Sam Allardyce his job as England manager.
results.secPara: The FAs chief executive also confirmed the body was conducting its own review of the powers and remit of its integrity unit. Glenn welcomed a renewed focus on the area in the wake of a bruising week of revelations that sparked questions over the games probity.
results.webTitle: FA’s Martin Glenn happy to cooperate with parliamentary inquiry

results.firPara: Contemplating the influence of his new centre-back Shkodran Mustafi, Arsène Wenger flashed a knowing look as his mind turned to Turf Moor. It was not quite on the scale of the wet-Tuesday-night-in-Stoke stereotype – for a start those notions tend to be addressed to flashier forward players rather than a determined defender – but the inference was there.
results.secPara: Mustafi has had a quietly impressive introduction to Premier League life, intensifying his efforts in the past week as Arsenal swatted aside Chelsea and then Basel in the Champions League. But now, Wenger muses, comes a different type of test. Lets see how he survives in games like Sunday against Burnley, where it is a case of Can I head the ball? Can I win the second ball? Wenger ponders.
results.webTitle: Arsenal’s Shkodran Mustafi ready for buffeting in the wilds of Burnley

results.firPara: Manchester City dropped their first points at Celtic on Wednesday, not bad going when the season began in mid-August and this is October. It had to happen sometime, though Pep Guardiola claims he would rather drop points in the Premier League than in the Champions League, on the basis that the domestic competition offers more time and games to make amends.
results.secPara: So far City have won six out of six Premier League games and, while they may not have had the most strenuous of opening programmes, they have managed to take maximum points from visits to Stoke, Swansea and Manchester United, which is not a treble many teams are going to pull off, even if a couple of those sides have been below par so far.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola: Manchester City would win title with three Fernandinhos

results.firPara: Argentinian has made his side hard to breach but not at the expense of creativity and this winning blend could prove decisive in the title race
results.secPara: If Sir Alex Fergusons credo that attack wins you games, defence wins you titles still held true, then Tottenham Hotspur, rather than Sundays visitors to White Hart Lane, Manchester City, would be the favourites to win the Premier League. But times have changed, which does not mean that Pep Guardiola and the rest of Mauricio Pochettinos counterparts should not look with envy at Spurs defence.
results.webTitle: Mauricio Pochettino's Spurs have balance to lay title claim against Manchester City

results.firPara: Dortmund failed to take advantage of Bayern Munichs slip-up earlier in the day and slumped to their second Bundesliga defeat of the season, going down 2-0 at Bayer Leverkusen.
results.secPara: Admir Mehmedi headed the home side in front early from a poorly defended corner and while Dortmund showed greater urgency after the break, fighting for the win that would have taken them to within a point of Bayern at the top of the table, it wasnt until the 73rd minute that Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang really tested Leverkusen goalkeeper Bernd Leno.
results.webTitle: Borussia Dortmund slip to defeat at Bayer Leverkusen in Bundesliga

results.firPara: It is 16 years now since the Football Association had the temerity to appoint its first foreign England manager, namely Sven-Goran Eriksson, and it can be enlightening to look back at the coverage of the time and remind yourself how many people seemed to think it was the end of civilisation as we knew it.
results.secPara: The Daily Mail is a good place to start when it comes to the froth of moral indignation that greeted the Swede. Englands humiliation knows no end. In their trendy eagerness to appoint a designer foreigner, did the FA pause for so much as a moment to consider the depth of this insult to our national pride? We sell our birthright down the fjord to a nation of seven million skiers and hammer-throwers who spend half their year living in total darkness.
results.webTitle: FA should look at credentials not passports for new England manager | Daniel Taylor

results.firPara: Huddersfield stay top, Brighton have another happy awayday, a memorable afternoon for Cambridges Will Norris and the 1000th EFL goal of the season
results.secPara: Huddersfield stay top, Brighton have another happy awayday, a memorable afternoon for Cambridges Will Norris and the 1000th EFL goal of the season
results.webTitle: Football League your thoughts: Tammy Abraham strikes again for Bristol City

results.firPara: • Adam Rooney scores two goals for Aberdeen
results.secPara: Rangers claimed their third win of the season after first-half goals from Niko Kranjcar and Andy Halliday sent them on their way to a 2-0 win at home to Partick Thistle.
results.webTitle: Scottish roundup: Nico Kranjcar on target as Rangers beat Partick
